item.title: Samantha add a quote by Apple Computer Inc.
item.description: "Here's to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do." -- Apple Computer Inc.

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "When the Day of Judgment dawns and people, great and small, come marching in to receive their heavenly rewards, the Almighty will gaze upon the mere bookworms and say to Peter, â€œLook, these need no reward. We have nothing to give them. They have loved reading." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Be patient toward all that is unsolved in your heart and try to love the questions themselves, like locked rooms and like books that are now written in a very foreign tongue. Do not now seek the answers, which cannot be given you because you would not be able to live them. And the point is, to live everything. Live the questions now. Perhaps you will then gradually, without noticing it, live along some distant day into the answer." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Books are the mirrors of the soul." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "She had the perpetual sense, as she watched the taxi cabs, of being out, out, far out to sea and alone; she always had the feeling that it was very, very, dangerous to live even one day." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "But then anyone who's worth anything reads just what he likes, as the mood takes him, and with extravagant enthusiasm." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Often on a wet day I begin counting up; what I've read and what I haven't read." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "No need to hurry. No need to sparkle. No need to be anybody but oneself." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Second hand books are wild books, homeless books; they have come together in vast flocks of variegated feather, and have a charm which the domesticated volumes of the library lack." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "That perhaps is your task--to find the relation between things that seem incompatible yet have a mysterious affinity, to absorb every experience that comes your way fearlessly and saturate it completely so that your poem is a whole, not a fragment; to re-think human life into poetry and so give us tragedy again and comedy by means of characters not spun out at length in the novelist's way, but condensed and synthesized in the poet's way--that is what we look to you to do now." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "I am rooted, but I flow." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "To look life in the face, always, to look life in the face, and to know it for what it is...at last, to love it for what it is, and then, to put it away..." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Life stand still here." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Beauty, the world seemed to say. And as if to prove it (scientifically) wherever he looked at the houses, at the railings, at the antelopes stretching over the palings, beauty sprang instantly. To watch a leaf quivering in the rush of air was an exquisite joy. Up in the sky swallows swooping, swerving, flinging themselves in and out, round and round, yet always with perfect control as if elastics held them; and the flies rising and falling; and the sun spotting now this leaf, now that, in mockery, dazzling it with soft gold in pure good temper; and now again some chime (it might be a motor horn) tinkling divinely on the grass stalksâ€”all of this, calm and reasonable as it was, made out of ordinary things as it was, was the truth now; beauty, that was the truth now. Beauty was everywhere." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Did it matter then, she asked herself, walking towards Bond Street, did it matter that she must inevitably cease completely? All this must go on without her; did she resent it; or did it not become consoling to believe that death ended absolutely?" -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "With her foot on the threshold she waited a moment longer in a scene which was vanishing even as she looked, and then, as she moved and took Minta's arm and left the room, it changed, it shaped itself differently; it had become, she knew, giving one last look at it over her shoulder, already the past." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Every face, every shop, bedroom window, public-house, and dark square is a picture feverishly turned--in search of what? It is the same with books. What do we seek through millions of pages?" -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "What matters in life is not what happens to you but what you remember and how you remember it." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Gabriel GarcÃ­a MÃ¡rquez
item.description: "Human beings are not born once and for all on the day their mothers give birth to them, but ... life obliges them over and over again to give birth to themselves." -- Gabriel GarcÃ­a MÃ¡rquez

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "You can never be overdressed or overeducated." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Each friend represents a world in us, a world possibly not born until they arrive, and it is only by this meeting that a new world is born." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "We write to taste life twice, in the moment and in retrospect." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "I am only responsible for my own heart, you offered yours up for the smashing my darling. Only a fool would give out such a vital organ" -- Anais Nin

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "The role of a writer is not to say what we can all say, but what we are unable to say." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "We do not grow absolutely, chronologically. We grow sometimes in one dimension, and not in another; unevenly. We grow partially. We are relative. We are mature in one realm, childish in another. The past, present, and future mingle and pull us backward, forward, or fix us in the present. We are made up of layers, cells, constellations." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "The possession of knowledge does not kill the sense of wonder and mystery. There is always more mystery." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I don't mind being burdened with being glamorous and sexual. Beauty and femininity are ageless and can't be contrived, and glamour, although the manufacturers won't like this, cannot be manufactured. Not real glamour; it's based on femininity." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Elinor Glyn
item.description: "Romance is the glamour which turns the dust of everyday life into a golden haze. " -- Elinor Glyn

item.title: Samantha add a quote by Dita Von Teese
item.description: "I advocate glamour. Everyday. Every minute" "Glamour above all things." -- Dita Von Teese
